description.narrative: In Cabo Delgado, Oxfam partners with AMA - a strong partner on human rights issues and conflict resolution related to Extractive Industries with strong community ties and expertise and trusted networks. AMA has solid relations with the government and inother local platforms such as the localities, administrative posts and districts in the provinces, consultative committees and focal points whom they train for the ongoing reporting of events and contextual information in real time. AMA is very public inits interventions.In Inhassaoro, Oxfam will furthermore work with the Platform of Extractive Industries of Inhassoro - a local partner with their feet on the ground and necessary contextual knowledge on situational developments in the area. Given the strong reports on serious human rights violations that have been reported in identified locations and the dynamic conflict trends in places like Cabo Delgado, promoting civic human rights and applying safeguarding principles will be central to the action and the approaches taken, not least to not put community members and partners at risk. The action will be based on a participatory conflict analysis to map out key conflict trends and challenges in identified areas, and specific vulnerbailites and needswithin communities, and a conflict sensitivity lens will be applied throughout the action, where emerging risks and conflict trends will be closely monitored and tracked to allow forswift responses. Conflict mitigation and developing a continuous mutualdialogue that involves civil society, communities, the private sector and the Government is at the core of the action, so that information generated is shared, and environment of trust is established, expectations aligned and agreement signed based on consensus. A particular focus of the action will be to work with community-based stakeholders, including women and youth, to strengthen and apply capacities for mediation and conflict resolution.

participating-org.narrative:
AMA was original created in May 19, 1990 in the City of Pemba, Province of Cabo Delgado with the name of NUMA (Nucleus of the Environment) and was recognized and authorized to work by the Governor of the Province on January 31, 1991. In 2001 Its was registered asAMA - Associacão do Meio Ambiente . It is registered in the Bulletin of the Republic No 20, Series III , 16 May 2007.
AMA main objective is to protect the Environment thorough the sustainable use of natural resources (including extractive resources) for the well being of communities. AMA uses massive education and promotes the inclusion of communities in the decision making process related to improving their lives. For the project partnership with OXFAM, AMA will work in the community rights related to the exploitation of natural resources in the district of Palma and Nhamanumbir , in Cabo Delgado .

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services

description.narrative: Citizens are mobilized, demand change and hold to account decision makers for fiscal and financial justice
men take action against poverty and inequality and/or hold governments/private sector to account for fairer financial policies
women take action against poverty and inequality and/or hold governments/private sector to account for fairer financial policies
